result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joshua L. Stromberg in court with attorney Peter C. Lloyd. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases 14CM458, 15CM21 and 15CM96.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
14CM458 - I/S - 9 mo Jail - Stayed: 24 mo Probation: AODA, Emplo, Other counseling, Apology letter to Adam Kitowski. No contact with A.K. during supervision. No restitution requested. Pay costs.
15CM21 - W/H Sentence: 24 mo Probation, concurrent with 14CM458: Same conditions, pay costs.
15CM96 - to be DRI
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CM458: No contest
15CM21: No contest
Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 14CM458 & 15CM21.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

15CM21 is Dismissed Read In
ADA Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Lloyd concurs with joint agreement.
Defendant makes statements. 

BY THE COURT:**********PROBATION******
14CM458 - I/S - 300 day Jail - huber, if approved by jail - Stayed: (credit to be agreed by stipulation)
24 mo Probation: 
Conditions:
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations., 
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Apology letter to Adam Kitowski. 
No direct/indirect contact with A.K. during supervision, except for apology letter. 
No restitution requested. 
Pay costs + DNA surcharge.
Pay attorney fees.

15CM21 - I/S - 300 day, concurrent Jail - huber, if approved by jail - Stayed: 
24 mo Probation, concurrent with 14CM458: Comply with same conditions as 14CM458. 
Pay costs + DNA surcharges. 

All cash bond in files to be applied towards attorney fees first.
Appeals info provided.

Defendant Joshua L. Stromberg in court with attorney Peter C. Lloyd. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY plea entered.

Atty Knaapen makes statements re: conditions of the bond.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
